org.youscope.common.measurement

Interface Measurement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface Measurement
extends Component
    Represents a measurement a microscope should do.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFinishDeviceSetting(DeviceSetting setting)
      Adds a device settings which should be applied (once) the measurement ends.
      void addMeasurementListener(MeasurementListener listener)
      Adds a listener which is notified about the state of the measurement.
      MeasurementTask addMultiplePeriodTask(int[] periods, int breakTime, int startTime)
      Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed.
      MeasurementTask addMultiplePeriodTask(int[] periods, int breakTime, int startTime, int numExecutions)
      Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed.
      void addStartupDeviceSetting(DeviceSetting setting)
      Adds a device setting which should be applied (once) the measurement starts.
      MeasurementTask addTask(int period, boolean fixedTimes, int startTime)
      Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times ( + i * ) ms, i = 0,1,2,..., the jobs of the task will be executed.
      MeasurementTask addTask(int period, boolean fixedTimes, int startTime, int numExecutions)
      Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times ( + i * ) ms, i = 0,1,2,..., the jobs of the task will be executed.
      java.util.Date getEndTime()
      Returns the time when the last execution of this measurement stopped regularly, or null, if it did not yet stop regularly.
      int getRuntime()
      Returns the runtime of the measurement.
      MeasurementSaver getSaver()
      Returns an interface which defines how (and if) the measurement should be saved.
      java.util.Date getStartTime()
      Returns the time when the last execution of this measurement started, or null, if it did not yet start.

      Returns the current state of the measurement.

      Returns a list of all tasks of this measurement.

      Starts the execution of the measurement.
      void stopMeasurement()
      Stops the execution of the measurement after all queued jobs were finished.
      void waitForMeasurementFinish()
      Stops the execution of the calling thread until the measurement is finished.

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns if measurement is currently running or not.
        Returns:
        True if measurement is running, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • quickStopMeasurement

        void quickStopMeasurement()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Stops the execution of the measurement after all queued jobs were finished. Note: If measurement is queued, it gets disabled but not un-queued.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setInitialMeasurementContextProperty

        void setInitialMeasurementContextProperty(java.lang.String identifier,
                                          java.io.Serializable property)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sets a measurement context property. The measurement context of the measurement will be initialized upon measurement initialization to already contain this context property. A measurement context property can be loaded and overwritten by any other measurement component in the measurement. Any property with the same identifier will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        identifier - a short identifier for the property.
        property - The property which should be saved.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getState

        MeasurementState getState()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the current state of the measurement.
        Returns:
        Current state.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • startMeasurement

        void startMeasurement()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Starts the execution of the measurement. Note: If other measurements are already running, the measurement gets queued.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • stopMeasurement

        void stopMeasurement()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Stops the execution of the measurement after all queued jobs were finished. Note: If measurement is queued, it gets disabled but not un-queued.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • waitForMeasurementFinish

        void waitForMeasurementFinish()
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Stops the execution of the calling thread until the measurement is finished.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • interruptMeasurement

        void interruptMeasurement()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Interrupts the execution of the measurement. All queued jobs are discarded.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • addMeasurementListener

        void addMeasurementListener(MeasurementListener listener)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Adds a listener which is notified about the state of the measurement.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener which should be notified.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • removeMeasurementListener

        void removeMeasurementListener(MeasurementListener listener)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Removes a previously added listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setRuntime

        void setRuntime(int measurementRuntime)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the runtime of the measurement.
        Parameters:
        measurementRuntime - Runtime of the measurement in milliseconds. Set to -1 for an infinite runtime.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getRuntime

        int getRuntime()
        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the runtime of the measurement.
        Returns:
        Runtime of the measurement. A value of -1 corresponds to an infinite runtime.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getStartTime

        java.util.Date getStartTime()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the time when the last execution of this measurement started, or null, if it did not yet start.
        Returns:
        Last measurement start time.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getEndTime

        java.util.Date getEndTime()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the time when the last execution of this measurement stopped regularly, or null, if it did not yet stop regularly.
        Returns:
        Last measurement stop time.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setLockMicroscopeWhileRunning

        void setLockMicroscopeWhileRunning(boolean lock)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   MeasurementRunningException
        Sets if write access to the microscope is locked during the measurement.
        Parameters:
        lock - True if should be locked.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • isLockMicroscopeWhileRunning

        boolean isLockMicroscopeWhileRunning()
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns if write access to the microscope is locked during the measurement.
        Returns:
        True if write access is locked.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setTypeIdentifier

        void setTypeIdentifier(java.lang.String type)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       MeasurementRunningException
        Sets an identifier for the type of this measurement. This identifier is usually the same as the one of the configuration.
        Parameters:
        type - Type identifier.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getTypeIdentifier

        java.lang.String getTypeIdentifier()
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a previously defined type identifier.
        Returns:
        Type identifier.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getSaver

        MeasurementSaver getSaver()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns an interface which defines how (and if) the measurement should be saved.
        Returns:
        Interface to measurement save options.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • addTask

        MeasurementTask addTask(int period,
                        boolean fixedTimes,
                        int startTime)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        MeasurementRunningException
        Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times ( + i * ) ms, i = 0,1,2,..., the jobs of the task will be executed. Same as addTask(period, fixedTimes, startTime, -1).
        Parameters:
        period - Time between single executions (in milliseconds).
        fixedTimes - TRUE if jobs should be done at fixed time intervals, FALSE if job may be delayed if microscope runs slow.
        startTime - The time when the jobs are started first (in ms).
        Returns:
        The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • addTask

        MeasurementTask addTask(int period,
                        boolean fixedTimes,
                        int startTime,
                        int numExecutions)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        MeasurementRunningException
        Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times ( + i * ) ms, i = 0,1,2,..., the jobs of the task will be executed. After executions of the task, the task won't be scheduled anymore
        Parameters:
        period - Time between single executions (in milliseconds).
        fixedTimes - TRUE if jobs should be done at fixed time intervals, FALSE if job may be delayed if microscope runs slow.
        startTime - The time when the jobs are started first (in ms).
        numExecutions - Maximal number of executions. -1 for an infinite amount.
        Returns:
        The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • addMultiplePeriodTask

        MeasurementTask addMultiplePeriodTask(int[] periods,
                                      int breakTime,
                                      int startTime)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                      MeasurementRunningException
        Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed. Same as addMultiplePeriodTask(periods, breakTime, startTime, -1).
        Parameters:
        periods - Times between single executions (in milliseconds).
        breakTime - After all periods are run through, the job will pause for ms and then start with periods[0] again.
        startTime - The time when the jobs should be started first (in ms).
        Returns:
        The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • addMultiplePeriodTask

        MeasurementTask addMultiplePeriodTask(int[] periods,
                                      int breakTime,
                                      int startTime,
                                      int numExecutions)
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                      MeasurementRunningException
        Adds a new task to the measurement so that at times {startTime, startTime + periods[0], startTime + periods[0] + periods[1], ..., startTime + sum_{i=0:size-2}(periods[i]), startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime, startTime + sum_{i=0:size-1}(periods[i]) + breakTime + periods[0]} the jobs of the task will be executed.
        Parameters:
        periods - Times between single executions (in milliseconds).
        breakTime - After all periods are run through, the job will pause for ms and then start with periods[0] again.
        startTime - The time when the jobs should be started first (in ms).
        numExecutions - Maximal number of executions. -1 for an infinite amount.
        Returns:
        The newly created task. If not successful, NULL is returned.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getTasks

        MeasurementTask[] getTasks()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a list of all tasks of this measurement.
        Returns:
        List of tasks.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
